Author: brett
Content: isn't part of the whole point that the thing scales up or down as you need it to? so, yeah, if you know up front what kind of constant bandwidth/storage/cpu load you are going to need then you're in a really good position to shop around for a better deal.

Author: palish
Content: Now I'm interested to know what it was.

Author: AlfredNgeno
Title: To VC or Not to VC? That is the Question...

Author: papersmith
Content: I'm leaning toward Rails because I've been using it since its early stage.  I also wrote stuffs in Django just out of curiosity, and it feels just as good.  I think they're both highly productive environments, and with the time it takes to read all the comparison articles, we could've written entire apps.
